The dog (Canis lupus familiaris or Canis familiaris) is a domesticated subspecies of the wolf, a mammal of the Canidae family of the order Carnivora. The term is used for both feral and pet varieties. The dog was the first domesticated animal and has been the most widely kept working, hunting, and pet animal in human history. The word "dog" can also refer to the male of a canine species, as opposed to the word "bitch" for the female of the species.
